entry.title: DFDL WG - document #365 (accepted): DO NOT CREATE TRACKERS HERE ON REDMINE
entry.content:
DFDL Trackers/Issues are now kept on github here:

https://github.com/OpenGridForum/DFDL/issues

entry.title: Editor - document #336 (author action): New GLUE Specification V 2.1 ready for public comment
entry.content: Please submit the attached GLUE Specification V 2.1 for public comment. It has already been thru the GLUE WG internal comment process.

entry.title: Mailing Lists - bug #303 (submitted): Error trying to access Mailman admin interface
entry.content:
Bug in Mailman version 2.1.20

We're sorry, we hit a bug!

Please inform the webmaster for this site of this problem. Printing of traceback and other system information has been explicitly inhibited, but the webmaster can find this information in the Mailman error logs.

entry.title: Mailing Lists - bug #302 (submitted): Mailing list not accepting e-mails
entry.content:
Can you please investigate why the e-mails below from Maria aren't reaching the glue-wg list? She is list member.

Thanks,

JP

Begin forwarded message:

From: Maria Alandes Pradillo <Maria.Alandes.Pradillo@cern.ch>
Subject: FW: Multicore related information in GLUE 2
Date: October 15, 2015 at 7:20:58 AM CDT
To: John-Paul Navarro <navarro@mcs.anl.gov>

Dear JP,

I wanted to send the mail below to the GLUE WG but I´m not able to do it. I don´t receive any mail back but the mail is not reaching the mailing list. Do you know why?

Otherwise, could you please forward it to the ML? I´m able to receive mails from other people, like the one recently sent by David Meredith.

Thanks!
Maria

From: Maria Alandes Pradillo 
Sent: 15 October 2015 09:11
To: glue-wg@ogf.org
Subject: FW: Multicore related information in GLUE 2

Dear all,

For some reason this message didn´t make it to the list. I try again.

Regards,
Maria

From: Maria Alandes Pradillo 
Sent: 13 October 2015 16:42
To: glue-wg@ogf.org
Subject: Multicore related information in GLUE 2

Dear all,

Are there any attributes in GLUE 2 describing multicore related information? For instance, I see that in GLUE2ComputingShare we have attributes like:

FreeSlots
FreeSlotsWithDuration
UsedSlots
RequestedSlots

What are they describing exactly? It´s not clear to me reading the documentation. Is there a way in GLUE 2 to specify whether a queue has access to multicore resources? Does this need to be done using OtherInfo attributes?

Thanks a lot,
Maria

entry.title: DRMAAv2 C Binding - bug #298 (submitted): GFD 194 specifies openMonitoringSession (in string cont...
entry.content:
drmaa2_msession drmaa2_open_msession (const char * session_name );

MonitoringSession openMonitoringSession (in string contact );

Session name as parameter does not make sense.

entry.title: OGF-44 - sessions #281 (submitted): Cloud Plugfest
entry.content:
Cloud Plugfests are working sessions open to developers oriented towards production and testing of working code for APIs, standards and implementations related to cloud standards.

At this session we will go over

entry.title: OGF-44 - sessions #280 (submitted): OCCI Extensions & Profiles
entry.content: Discussion with EGI FedCloud & INDIGO members regarding OCCI extensions and community-produced profiles

entry.title: OGF-44 - sessions #279 (submitted): CAOPS and IGTF session
OGF-44 - sessions #278 (submitted): Delegation of credentials
entry.content: Delegation of credentials is done using several methods; previously it was done primarily with GSI proxies but is now also using OAuth. Moonshot does not have delegation yet - what will delegation look like in Moonshot?

entry.title: OGF-44 - sessions #268 (submitted): OCCI Monitoring
entry.content: Description of the OCCI-Monitoring extension with examples

entry.title: OGF-44 - sessions #267 (submitted): Managing identiy and authorisation with AARC
entry.content:
This session is an update session on federated identity management, focusing in particular on the AARC project.

AARC is a H2020 funded project, led by Terena.

The session will also look at EUDAT (EUDAT2020) and EUDAT's user communities, and EGI.

entry.title: OCCI WG - bug #262 (submitted): read-only access to repository
entry.content:
Hi,
It seems url for read-only access is broken (404)
https://redmine.ogf.org/projects/occi-wg/repository

Is it possible to fix it or it is on purpose ?

entry.title: OGF-42 - sessions #159 (submitted): FEDSEC-CG
entry.content: FEDSEC is looking at federated identity management for clouds and grids and e/cyberinfrastructure. The purpose of this session is to give an overview of federated identity management for research infrastructures, looking - among other things - at the work proposed in Horizon 2020 in Europe and the work contributed by the major projects currently working in the field.

entry.title: OGF-42 - sessions #158 (submitted): CAOPS session
entry.content: This is a brief session covering software for CAs: the purpose is to review the state of the art and promote the sharing of software and experiences with software, not just full "solutions" but also individual libraries.

entry.title: OGF-42 - sessions #157 (submitted): VOMSPROC-WG
entry.content: VOMSPROC is the group for documenting the correct processing of attributes in VOMS certificate chains. This session is an update on the status of the document, and also aims to develop a roadmap for the future of VOMSPROC: is the group's work done, or is anything more needed?
